DOC.brief_summary: Objective : This purpose pilot study explore potential usefulness Synera treatment pain associate shoulder impingement syndrome .
DOC.brief_title: Pain Patch Versus Injections Treatment Pain Associated With Shoulder Impingement Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects receive either subacromial injection baseline issue Synera patch use daily 2 week PRN additional 2 week .
DOC.criteria: least 18 year age . pain associated shoulder impingement syndrome single shoulder ( minimum 2week duration ) . tenderness attachment site rotator cuff tendon . positive Hawkin 's Neer 's sign . report average pain intensity score 4 ( 11point scale ) past 24 hour Screening/Baseline visit . use topically applied pain medication target treatment area within 14 day precede Study Day 1 , nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) , menthol , methyl salicylate , local anesthetic ( include LidodermÂ® ) , steroid . use injected medication within 60 day precede Study Day 1 , local anesthetic ( lidocaine ) steroid . clinically significant illness within 14 day Screening/Day 1 , opinion investigator , would preclude subject participate study . receive class 1 antiarrhythmic drug ( ie , tocainide , mexiletine , etc . ) history and/or past diagnosis severe hepatic disease . participate clinical trial unapproved drug within 30 day prior screen . pregnant , breastfeeding , female childbearing potential practicing acceptable method birth control . unable unwilling , opinion investigator , comply study procedure cooperate fully research staff . file disability claim currently receive disability payment shoulder impingement syndrome .
